title: Inferring Soil Drydown Behaviour with Adaptive Bayesian Online Changepoint Analysis
summary: This paper introduces extensions to Bayesian Online Changepoint Detection (BOCPD) to infer soil drydown behavior from continuous soil-moisture measurements. The model captures piecewise dynamics and accommodates unknown parameters, using a particle-filter approach for realistic inference of segment-specific behaviors over time.
usefulness_reason: Score 65 assigned because the paper deals with continuous soil-moisture measurements, which can be considered spatio-temporal data. The 'piecewise dynamics' and 'changepoint detection' relate to modeling events over time and space, showing some overlap with point processes, although it's not explicitly a point process paper.
